document.docAuthor: Çiftçi, Derya, Růžička, Jan, Hasbenli, Abdullah & Şahin, Ülfet
document.masterDocTitle: The large carrion beetles (Coleoptera: Silphidae) of Turkey: a review with a new species record

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The large carrion beetles (Coleoptera: Silphidae) of Turkey: a review with a new species record

(1830) Illustrations of British entomology; or, a synopsis of indigeneous insects: containing their generic and specific distinctions; with an account of their metamophoses, times of appearance, localities, food, and economy, as far as practicable. Mandibulata. Vol. III. Baldwin & Cradock, London, 374 + [5] pp., pls. 16 - 19.

Distribution in Turkey .
Tokat , Ordu , Artvin (
Háva et al . 1998
); Adana , Niğde , Mersin ( Açar 2008 ); Çankırı , Tokat , Ordu , Rize , Artvin ( Sikes & Venables 2013a , b ).

Remarks. Widely distributed Palaearctic species, known from most of Europe to Eastern Siberia and the west of China (Růžička 2015). In central Europe, abundant both in forested habitats and in open habitats such as fields and grasslands ( Růžička 1994 ; Jakubec & Růžička 2012 , 2015 ). In Turkey , distributed within Eastern Anatolia , southeastern Anatolia and the Aegean Regions ( Fig. 28 ). Here we provide the first records from Ankara , Antalya , Erzurum , Eskişehir , Konya and İstanbul Provinces.
